```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
V <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # voltage (V)
I <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # current (A)

ans <- signif(V / I, 2)
dis <- c(V * I, I / V)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{\\Omega}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
A lamp draws a current of $`r I` \,\mathsf{A}$ when it is connected to a 
$`r V` \,\mathsf{V}$ source. What is the resistance of the lamp?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use Ohm's law:

$$R = \frac{V}{I} = \frac{`r V` \,\mathsf{V}}{`r I` \,\mathsf{A}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$$
